Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. In Video:Kolkata: Former Miss India Ushoshi Sengupta harassed, 7 arrestedDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

CM to take final call on Class 12 exam r.description: CHENNAI: Final call on reducing in the number of subjects for Class XII state board students will be taken by the Chief Minister's office after receiving feedback from public and educationists, said school education minister K A Sengottaiyan. Speaking to reporters here on Tuesday, he said at present there is no change and students will continue to be trained in six subjects and orders providing options for medical and engineering would be issued only after public consultation. TOI on Saturday had reported that the government is planning to reduce the number of subjects from six to five next year and thereby reducing total marks from 600 to 500 on the lines of CBSE schools and neighbouring states of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. Besides this, the minister responded to reports on delay in distribution of free textbooks to primary students in many government schools. It has been more than 15 days since the schools reopened. "There is no major delay in distribution of textbooks. If there was a lag in one or two schools, books will reach them in a day or two. We have changed syllabuses for eight classes at a time this year," he said. Sengottaiyan refuted claims that government schools are being closed due to water shortage. "Reports that toilets at Chengelpet government school turned dysfunctional is false. They were locked after classes get over around four in the evening". Answering to questions on 25% admission in private schools under the RTE quota, he said that the entire process was transparent and assured that efforts are being taken to bring more CBSE schools under the online admission portal. Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu parties differ over \u2018One.description: CHENNAI: The regional parties in Tamil Nadu have a different take on the move by Prime Minister Narendra Modi to push forward the ‘One Nation; One Election’ move and for which he has convened a meeting of all parties on June 19 in New Delhi. While the ruling AIADMK is concerned about completing its full term and willing to look at this beyond 2024, the opposition DMK feels such a move is impossible to implement. AIADMK is deputing law minister C Ve Shanmugam and RS floor leader A Navaneethakrishnan to attend the all-party meeting on June 19. “In its earlier representation to the Law Commission in New Delhi last year, the party demanded that the ruling dispensation should be allowed to complete its full term until 2021, but said it had no objections to simultaneous polls from 2024, if necessary. It remains unclear if the party high command maintains its status given the political dynamics,” said a senior minister, seeking anonymity. “We had already taken a stand on this and I do not think there will be any change on that now. Our utmost concern is to complete the present term. Even last year, when the topic surfaced, Modi government was to advance elections to six states, including Maharashtra and Jharkhand, which are to face assembly polls in a few months from now. But, they did not do it,” pointed out another minister, who did not want to be named. The DMK was of the stand that it was impossible to implement and depended on various factors. “While we had general elections in 1989, 1991, 1996, 1998 and 1999, the Lok Sabha was dissolved in 1991, 1998 and 1999 for want of a majority for the ruling dispensation. If such a case is to arise later, will the state assemblies, where the ruling party may be in a majority, be dissolved?” wondered DMK spokesman and party’s RS member T K S Elangovan. “Several states are ruled by parties, which have little or no role at the Centre. Their mandates are different. Such a move is not needed at all and it is impossible to implement it,” he said. For its part, the PMK felt there were benefits, but issues too. “Our youth wing leader (Anbumani Ramadoss) had earlier said it was a good move, considering the cost benefits. But, it is practically not possible to implement. Our party is yet to take a call on this,” PMK spokesman K Balu said. “From lowering expenditure aspect, it is a welcome move. But, there are issues in implementing it,” he said. Former chief election commissioner T S Krishnamurthy said theoretically it was attractive and desirable too. “But, implementation wise there are problems and needs constitutional amendments. It is difficult to implement. While administrative wise, we will need more arrangements, it will surely result in savings on expenditure and may result in more administrative work for the legislatures. But, constitutional obstacles must be addressed and changed,” said Krishnamurthy. (With inputs from Julie Mariappan) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Green Card.description: NEW DELHI: In an attempt to strike a balance between those standing in queue for decades for employment-based green cards (owing to the per country caps) and the need to protect American workers, a bill - 'The Fairness for High Skilled Immigrants Act (S.386)', has been recently amended by Republican Senator Mike Lee. The amendments are being seen as a bid to facilitate its passage. To provide more protection to American workers, it requires that the employer sponsoring H-1B workers must disclose online (for at least 30 days) various details of the job on offer, such as occupation or job position, education and experience requirements, location and also how to apply for this job. A filing fee is also sought to be introduced forLabour Condition Applications(LCA), which is an attestation-based requirement that has to be met by sponsoring employers prior to filing of H-1B visa applications. This bill was originally introduced in the US Senate on February 7. It sought to remove the per country cap on employment-based green cards and shorten the wait time for the vast majority of applications in the backlog. US issues 1.40 lakh employment-based green cards annually. Substantial increase in denial of H-1B petitions of Indians: ReportHowever, not more than 7% can go to nationals of any one country. With a high influx of the Indian diaspora in the US, it has resulted in a heavy backlog, with those in the EB-2 category (having advanced degrees) having to face a wait time of 151 years. "Over the last decade, various bills to remove this per country cap, have failed to become law. S. 386 has been rescued from the fate of its predecessors through appeasement, specifically, by agreeing to amendments that would allow further restrictions on merit-based non-immigrant visas, particularly with regards to the H-1B programme. However, it is interesting to note that many of these so-called 'new' restrictions already exist in one form or another," Florida based immigration attorney, Ashwin Sharma, told TOI. For instance, even currently,   H-1B sponsoring employers have to certify   that they are not favouring immigrant workers over American workers. They have to indicate how they calculated the prevailing wages they are offering to H-1B workers (but these records are to be made available only on specific request of the concerned authorities), explained Sharma. While the bill would alleviate the green card backlog and significantly benefit India, followed by China, it also seeks to ensure that the green card for others is not delayed beyond the time it would have otherwise taken, had this bill not been passed. Another similar bill HR 1044, introduced by the Democrats is pending in the US House. 'Immigration Voice', a US based non-profit which is engaged in alleviating problems faced by legal highly-skilled immigrants, in its social media post on June 17, said that it has reached a deal with Senator Lee and the amendments will enable the bill to pass. "We have a deal to break the deadlock in the Senate!," it posted on Twitter. A note, issued by it analysing the various facets of S.386 including the amendments, states that the bill allows investigations against H-1B frauds to be based on anonymous complaints, eliminates arbitrary deadlines on investigations and permits investigations for general non-compliance with LCA requirements, as opposed to simply for a wilful violation. It seeks to increase the penalties for LCA violations that have remained unchanged since 1990. Whistle-blower protection, which is already available, is also incorporated in the amendment. The fee proposed for LCA documentation will be used to fund the department of labour's (DOL's) administrative and investigative activities associated with H-1B programme. A few amendments in the bill, such as the 30 day internet posting requirement, could cause delays and challenges, states an immigration expert. Another counsel says: "Companies can depute their employees on a B-1 (business) visa to the US for a temporary period. The requirement was that the salary should be borne by the non-US employer. While a B-1 was getting tougher to obtain, it was an option available. The bill seeks to eliminate the 'B-1 in lieu of H-1B' option. We need to see how this will pan out." In Video:Bill seeking to lift green card cap amended to protect US workersDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Business News.

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Tamil Nadu\u2019s water woes will echo i.description: CHENNAI: The newly elected DMK MPs will raise Tamil Nadu’s water crisis in the Parliament and urge the Centre to provide a permanent solution at the earliest. DMK parliamentary party chief T R Baalu said people across the state were suffering without water and Chennai was the worst-hit region. “We will raise the issue in the Lok Sabha at the earliest,” he said. The DMK MPs would demand abolition of Neet, dropping hydrocarbon projects in the delta districts, supply of Tamil Nadu’s due share of Cauvery water and scrapping of the proposed Mekedatu dam project across the Cauvery river in Karnataka, he said. DMK president M K Stalin had recently said that before passing judgment on the DMK MPs, people should wait and see as to how they perform in the Parliament. “The opposition has a space in a democratic set up. We will use it fully and raise issues concerning Tamil Nadu. We will fight for the promises we gave in our manifesto. If the BJP government does not respond, they will stand exposed,” said Baalu. Sitting in the opposition, MPs get better opportunity to raise issues, felt Villupuram MP D Ravikumar, a VCK leader elected on DMK symbol. The DMK has chosen to turn a deaf ear to the taunting of AIADMK and BJP leaders who have wondered what the DMK-front MPs would be able to do, sitting in the opposition. Former Union minister of state Pon Radhakrishnan had said the 37 opposition MPs from Tamil Nadu should sell their assets to write off farm and education loans of the voters who had elected them. Man, 43, goes searching for scooter, fin.description: CHENNAI: A man who parked his scooter and went to buy fish from the Villivakkam market on Sunday, returned to find a rusty pistol abandoned nearby and his two-wheeler missing. He later handed over the pistol to personnel at the Rajamangalam police station and lodged a complaint about his missing two-wheeler. Police said 43-year-old Sargunam, a cabbie, was a resident of Kolathur and was on his Sunday visit to buy fish from the market near Villivakkam railway station. “He parked his red scooter near the market. When he returned after making the purchase, his scooter was missing,” a police officer said, quoting from Sargunam’s complaint. Sargunam looked around for his scooter and asked people if they’d seen it. Getting desperate, he ventured closer to the railway gate, where he found the pistol in a cloth bag. “He said he got curious as to what was in the bag and opened to find the pistol. Then he brought it to us,” the officer said. Personnel at the Rajamangalam station said the 9mm pistol was not loaded. “The pistol was a bit rusty, indicating that it was not used in the recent past. There were no marks or names identifying the make of the pistol either,” said an investigating officer. Police suspect it to be a country-made crude pistol. “Ballistics and forensic experts will examine the pistol to verify its make and model and submit a detailed report soon,” he added. Rajamangalam police have registered a case. The pistol was surrendered in Egmore magistrate court on Monday. Police are checking CCTV camera footage from the vicinity to trace the ones who dumped the pistol and the miscreant who stole Sargunam’s scooter. Rajiv Gandhi assassination: Tamil Nadu g.description: CHENNAI: After raising security concern over permitting Rajiv Gandhi assassination case life convict Nalini Sriharan to appear in court to argue her plea seeking six months’ leave from imprisonment to make arrangements for her daughter’s marriage, the Tamil Nadu government on Tuesday informed the Madras high court that she could be allowed to argue through video conferencing. Recording the submission, a division bench of Justice M M Sundaresh and M Nirmal Kumar directed the government to find out whether Nalini has any objection or if she is willing to submit her contentions through video conferencing. In a recent hearing, the court made it clear that she could not be denied her right to appear in person to argue her case. Nalini, who has been in prison for over 27 years, wanted the high court to direct the superintendent of police of the Special Prison for Women in Vellore to produce her before the court so that she could argue her case for leave as a party-in-person. According to Nalini, a life convict is entitled to one month leave once in two years and since she had never availed such ordinary leave for more than 27 years, she made a representation to the prison authorities on February 25 seeking six months leave to make arrangement for her daughter’s marriage. Subsequently, Nalini’s mother also made a similar representation on March 22. As the authorities failed to consider her representation, she moved the high court. Originally, Nalini was sentenced to death. Subsequently, her death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment by the Tamil Nadu government on April 24, 2000. Claiming that after commutation of her death sentence around 3,700 life convicts -- who had served ten years of imprisonment and less -- were released by the state government, Nalini said, “My request to the state for premature release under 1994 scheme of premature release of life convicts was cleared by the council of ministers, and on September 9, 2018, the council advised the governor to release me and other six life convicts in the case. But it has been over six months and the decision of the state still remains unimplemented.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PMJAY beneficiary identification and awa.description: CHENNAI: Southern Railway medical department on Tuesday conducted a beneficiary identification and awareness drive at Dr MGR Central Railway Station as part of the Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY) programme. National Health Agency has identified 91 railway hospitals and health units across 16 zones of Indian Railway for rendering universal healthcare to about 10.74 crore poor, deprived rural families and identified occupational categories of urban workers’ families.  These hospitals will implement the PMJAY scheme providing a cover up to Rs 5 lakh per family per year, for secondary and tertiary hospitalisation and cashless access to healthcare services at the point of service to eligible individuals. Seven railway hospitals from Southern Railway have been empanelled for implementation of PMJAY programme. The one-day camp was launched in the presence of several railway officials as well as officials from the state government A number of contractual staff from various railway departments including coolie porters (Sahayaks) and Safai Karmacharis attended the camp and were identified as beneficiaries under PMJAY programme. The Union Government launched the PMJAY in September 2018. So far, over 3.72 crore beneficiary e-cards have been generated under the scheme and over 28.91 hospital admissions were made under the scheme ensuring quality access to healthcare for the poor. For more details https://www.pmjay.gov.in/ Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

French NGO builds school for disadvantag.description: CHENNAI: Monaco-based philanthropist and president of international humanitarian organisation Cuomo Foundation, Elena Cuomo, will inaugurate their latest initiative, Amala Annai Higher Secondary School in Mambakkam, on Thursday. The school, built in partnership with the Diocese of Chengalpet, is the foundation’s seventh educational project in Tamil Nadu, and is among the few to receive the ‘Platinum – National Excellence’ rating from the Indian Green Building Council (IGBC), for energy-efficient design. According to Charles Kulandai, the foundation’s project manager in India, the new school will replace a previous structure by the same name, which reportedly lacked basic infrastructure. “Besides this, girl students from about 22 villages in the vicinity were made to drop out after Class X, as the nearest school for Class XI and XII was in Chengalpet, about 15km away,” he said. The new school will have classes from VI to XII, and can accommodate more than 800 students. The campus, about a mile’s distance from the old one, has been built using eco-friendly material around two green atriums. It has 21 well-ventilated classrooms, separate physics, chemistry and biology laboratories, a library, audio-visual centres, an auditorium, separate toilet blocks and expansive outdoor sports facilities. Designed by architect Priya Lourduraj, the school has adopted water-efficient landscaping with reuse of stockpiled soil, and native and drought-tolerant tree species. It also uses eco-friendly refrigerants and fire extinctions. “We focus quite a bit on our school programmes, because when children are young, they can imbibe ways to live in harmony with nature and use energy frugally, early on,” says CN Raghavendran, chairman of IGBC’s Chennai chapter. Elena and her late husband Alfredo who started the foundation together in 2001, had undertaken several projects in Tamil Nadu, since they started working here two decades ago. “Education is a cause that has always been at the top of our agenda in India. It is a passport to a better future and we are convinced that equipping children from disadvantaged communities with quality education is what will change their circumstances,” says Elena. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. Tamil Nadu govt officials asked to be in.description: CHENNAI: Tamil Nadu chief secretary’s office has issued a circular asking all secretaries as well as their department officials to be in their office at 10am sharp. “All secretaries to government are requested to be available in their office at 10am and during the office hours. The same instruction may be reiterated to the heads of departments and other staff under your control,” said the circular from chief secretary Girija Vaidyanathan. The circular was dated June 17. Secretaries in the Secretariat confirmed that they have received the circular through post. “We received the circular by post and I have circulated the same my department officials,” said a senior secretary not willing to be quoted. “There are complaints about some officials not coming to office at the appointed time. There are many officials who don’t come on time in the morning and soon after coming to the office, they don’t start their work immediately. This must be the reason for the chief secretary to issue the circular,” said the secretary. On June 13, Prime Minister Narendra Modi asked all the Union ministers to be in office by 9.30am and not to work from home. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Demand for homes and rents go up where t.description: CHENNAI: The quest is no longer for potable water. With even borewells that used to yield highly saline water going dry in most places, people are looking to move to apartment complexes in the city that have supply of any kind of water at least for a few hours a day. Realtors say rentals are rising in apartment complexes that are able to ensure water supply to residents. “There is demand for apartments where the residents’ welfare associations are able to ensure water supply. Customers are asking us to identify only such apartments. But cost of maintenance is going up in such apartments on account of increasing water charges. All these have resulted in indirect increase in rentals,” said Jayant Hemdev, business director, Hemdev’s Real Estate. Residents in some of the swanky suburbs are eyeing the core areas of the city, where the borewells still yield some water or the tanker service is better. “What can one do when there is no water for your ablutions and daily chores? You end up shifting to better places,” says K Hari, whose search for a rental apartment in the city started two weeks ago. He is desperate to move out of OMR. A resident of an apartment complex in Vepery says he moved into it only a month ago. His search for another apartment complex has already started as there is no water in the present one. Scarcity is not caused merely by reduction in water supply by Metrowater. Drying up of borewells across the city and its suburbs has compounded the problem. When Metrowater used to supply 830 MLD of water in the past, Chennai residents used to also tap groundwater from borewells at will. But the borewells are drying up and, municipal administration minister S P Velumani admits, Metrowater supply has fallen to 525 MLD (million litres a day). The secretary of a residential complex near Anna Nagar says, “Of late, we have been noticing that there is an influx of people into our building. On inquiry, we came to know that most of them are relatives of our members. They have moved into our building from different parts of the city in search of water. It is a strain on our pocket because cost of maintenance is shooting up. We never used to buy water from tankers. But last month, we spent Rs2.5 lakh on tankers and this month it is expected to touch Rs6 lakh. Our corpus reserves are fast depleting. The only way out is to reduce water supply. If there is water scarcity, outsiders will naturally leave.” Meanwhile, all major hyper-malls and departmental stores have been reporting huge sales of buckets, pots and other containers used to store water. Attack on Kolkata docs calls for introsp.description: Chennai: In the past few years, incidents of violence against doctors across the country are, if not common, not rare. The proximate causes are always the same. A patient dies or his or her condition worsens, and the patient’s relatives feel doctors have not given enough care. In crowded public sector hospitals, people may have this perception due to the sheer volume of patients and the inadequate number of medical personnel. However, the fact that violence occurs in private hospitals too, where the number of patients is not as much, points to a trust deficit between patients and doctors. The Indian Medical Association in a study has shown that 75% of doctors face some sort of violence, verbal or physical, in their career. The reasons for the trust deficit are multiple. In public sector hospitals, there is a perception that doctors do not respect them are, uncaring or are not the best, else they would be working in the private sector. In the private sector they are seen as out to make money and not committed enough. The common thread is that doctors are not caring enough. The structure of medical training and practice in India is such that such a perception of the medical profession among the public is almost inevitable. The medical profession continues to remain one of the most sought after by students. But in the past few decades there has been a dramatic shift in the way medicine is practised. The advent of advanced technology in medical care, mainly in the private sector, has given rise to unreasonable expectations in the minds of the public that medical care can solve any ailment. The situation is worsened by the continuous barrage of advertisement by the private sector, much of it misleading, if not downright dishonest. The public has been given the impression that no one can die in a hospital, if the doctor is skillful enough and caring enough. In spite of all this, violence against the doctor would be infrequent if there was a general respect for civic values. In the absence of effective redressal measures, people take law into their own hands either out of desperation or because they are aware that perpetrators of such violence are seldom, if ever, brought to book. To immediately stop such violence against doctors, the state should take exemplary action against those indulging in violence. In any civilized society, justice has to be delivered by a fair mechanism. Only failed republics resort to violent vigilante action. Should doctor’s strike? In the best of all possible worlds, they should not. When they are the targets of violence, and no redressal seems possible, it is understandable that they will resort to such means as will draw attention to their plight. The fact that it has taken so many days to resolve shows that society is uncaring of their distress. In the long term, the ability of every individual to access quality healthcare through a transparent system is the way forward. This requires greater funding and a complete change in the way medical care is delivered in the country. (The writer is an orthopaedic surgeon at St Isabel’s Hospital, Chennai) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pride Month: Chennai event to discuss ho.description: CHENNAI: As part of the Pride Month celebrations, Chennai Photo Biennale Foundation will conduct a panel discussion and film screening, Art+Inclusion, on June 22. The event will be held at Alliance Française of Madras from 11am to 2pm. The event will begin with a panel discussion. “It will deal with how the LGBT community is handling their struggles and challenges through the visual medium. They are not making movies just to show their struggles but to also fight their battles through it, by educating people,” says Arun Vijai Mathavan, programme manager, Chennai Photo Biennale. Panellists include activist and director Malini Jeevarathnam, artist Chandri Narayan from Aravani Art Project, Trishala from Periferry and Jaya from Sahodaran. The panel will be moderated by photographer Steevez Rodriguez, the co-founder of Pep Collective, and creative head at Error Studio. The panel discussion will be followed by the screening of “Ladies and Gentlewomen,” a Tamil documentary directed by Malini Jeevarathnam, and produced by Pa Ranjith. The film revolves around love, life, and suicide among lesbians. The film has received numerous awards, including the best documentary award in three international film festivals. If you have any queries, write to contact@chennaiphotobiennale.com, arunvijai@chennaiphotobiennale.com Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. A division bench of Justice MM Sundaresh and M Nirmal Kumar directed the government to find out Nalini’s opinion on the issue after Tamil Nadu government raised a security concern and opposed her plea to appear in court and argue her case in person. The government, however, suggested that she could be allowed to argue through video conferencing. Earlier, the court had made it clear that she could not be denied her right to appear in person to argue her case. Nalini, who is India’s longest-serving woman prisoner having spent more than 27 years in jail, wanted the high court to direct the superintendent of police of the Special Prison for Women in Vellore to produce her before the court so that she could argue her case for leave as a party-in-person. Nalini said that as a life convict she was entitled to one month leave once in two years and since she had never availed herself of such ordinary leave for more than 27 years, she made a representation to prison authorities on February 25 seeking six months’ leave to arrange for her daughter’s marriage. Nalini’s mother also made a similar representation on March 22. As the authorities failed to consider her representation, she moved the high court. Originally, Nalini was sentenced to death. Subsequently, her death sentence was commuted to life imprisonment by the Tamil Nadu government on April 24, 2000. Claiming that after commutation of her death sentence around 3,700 life convicts — who had served 10 years of imprisonment and less — were released by the state government, Nalini said: “My request to the state for premature release under the 1994 scheme of premature release of life convicts was cleared by the council of ministers, and on September 9, 2018, the council advised the governor to release me and other six life convicts in the case. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. \nJanani Iyer posed for the shutterbugs.description: This one was for the launch of a new restaurant, Vimalam Mess — a place that promises to bring to Chennaiites the taste of home-cooked food. “You get to taste traditional Chettinad cuisine, tastefully made with hand-ground masalas, served in an inviting, homely ambience,” explained project head, Rajagopal. “We aim to provide top-class food at affordable prices, without compromising on quality and quantity,” he added. VTV Ganesh, Mirchi Shiva, Mohan, Sundar C and Vichu inaugurated the place by lighting the kuthuvilakku. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu woman, paramour murder her so.description: VELLORE: Police on Tuesday arrested a 25-year old woman in Vellore district of Tamil Nadu and her paramour for murdering her four-year-old son. Kaviya and her paramour, Thiyagarajan of Ranipet, murdered her son on Thursday as they felt that he was an obstacle to their extramarital affair. The Walajapet police on Tuesday exhumed the boy’s body which was buried on the Palar river bank on Friday night. After postmortem, the body was buried again. Police said Kaviya got married to Ramachandran 30, a daily wage earner at Ranipet SIPCOT, in 2014. The couple used to fight. In 2017, when their son, Tharun, was two years old, Kaviya estranged from Ramachandran and returned to her parents’ home at Pakkupettai. Kaviya, who joined for BEd at a private teacher education college in Ranipet, developed an extramarital affair with cab driver Thiyagarajan, 30. Though Kaviya had not obtained legal divorce from her first husband, she married Thiyagarajan in January 2019 after informing her family members. She started to live in Thiyagarajan’s house along with her son. Initially, they were living in his parents’ home. A week ago, they moved to a rented house at Belliyappa Nagar. In their confessional statement, the couple said, “Since Tharun was an obstacle to our intimacy, we decided to murder him. We drowned him in a water-filled tub on Thursday morning.”  “We covered his body in a polythene sack and continued with our daily routine. On Friday night, we carried his body to a burial ground on the Palar river bank and buried it there,” they said. Later, in an inebriated condition, Thiyagarajan told his friend about the murder of the boy. The friend informed Thenkadappathangal village administrative officer Adhiyaman, who in turn alerted the police. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PIL wants censor clearance for Big Boss.description: CHENNAI: A PIL to restrain Star Vijay TV from broadcasting Kamal Haasan’s ‘Big Boss’ show without censor certificate has been filed in Madras high court. It wanted the court to direct authorities concerned to constitute a committee to censor the programme. It also also wanted the curt to direct the Indian Broadcasting Foundation (IBF) to take appropriate action against the television channel and producer of the show Endemole India Private Limited for conducting the programme in derogation with IBF’s content code and certification rules. According to petitioner K Suthan, IBF’s rules expressly prohibits sex, obscenity and also indecent degrading, derogatory contents. But television channels across the country are least bothered about the rules. “Particularly, the ‘Big Boss’ show hosted by renowned actor Kamal Haasan is being telecast with abusive content only with the view to increase the TRP rating and get monetary benefits without any social responsibility,” he said. Pointing out that feature films are permitted to be screened only after obtaining clearance from the censor board, the petitioner said such contents telecast in television channels do not go through any scrutiny. Claiming that parents and elders are embarrassed and worried as even children are attracted to such shows, the petitioner as an interim measure wanted the court to restrain the television channel from telecasting the show without clearance from censor board. The PIL is likely to be heard by a division bench of Justice S Manikumar and Justice Subramonium Prasad on Wednesday. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu: 90% students of Thiruvalluva.description: CHENNAI: More than 90% of final year BSc (mathematics) students of 123 colleges, who appeared for the practical examination of ‘C Language’, conducted by Thiruvalluvar University in Vellore, have received single digit marks. The results of the students of these colleges spread over Vellore, Tiruvannamalai, Cuddalore and Villupuram, were published on June 14. Discrepancies were found in the results of other subjects as well with students’ marks found to be significantly reduced. Students and teachers of the government, government-aided and constituent colleges of the university have demanded re-valuation and a probe. Controller of Examinations Professor B Senthil Kumar, however, said it was “a minor error”. Such errors occurred only in the practicals for ‘C Language’, he said. “After the results, we have communicated to all the affiliated colleges to give their representations regarding the discrepancies. More than 50% of the colleges have responded. We will rectify it and publish the results in a day or two,” he said, abruptly ending the call when asked about a similar marking pattern in at least three other subjects, including Zoology, Linear Algebra and Real Analyses. When this reporter tried the CoE’s line for further clarification, a staff of the university (Ramesh) attended the call and said the officer had left for “an urgent meeting”. Repeated attempts to reach Thiruvalluvar University Vice-Chancellor S Thamarai Selvi failed. Sources in the university said a majority of the students of BSc and MSc mathematics have been given single digit marks in the sixth and fourth-semester examinations respectively. Practical marks in several subjects in other disciplines like BSc Zoology, BSC Computer Science and BCA have also been similar. For instance, 144 of 204 students of Tiruvannamalai Government College and 140 out of 201 students of Cheyyar Government College were awarded 2 or 3 out of 15 ‘external’ marks in practicals. “The students have been given identical marks and marked as ‘RA’ (reappear). It shows the irresponsible approach of the university. We strongly condemn this and demand an inquiry,” said Vellore zonal secretary of TN government colleges teachers’ association D Vijayan. A mathematics professor of a government college, on the condition of anonymity, said none of the 141 students from his college cleared the exam. They have been awarded marks in the range of 0 to 3 in practicals. “Many of the students, who have been maintaining 80% to 90% marks in all the semesters have been given single digit marks, a maximum of 7 out of 75 for the external in two theory papers (Linear Algebra and Real Analyses). It will affect the students’ academics,” he said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

IIT-M study models to extract methane fr.description: CHENNAI: A team of researchers from Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM) has embarked on a project to develop new techniques for extracting methane from natural gas hydrates. Gas hydrates are ice-like cages, found in Indian continental coastline, in which methane gas is trapped. According to official data, over 1,900 trillion cubic meters of methane gas is untapped in these cages. This is 1,500 times more than country’s present gas reserve. Methane, in the form of natural gas, is used to generate electricity and make energy. The researchers are studying new methane extraction methods so that country's natural gas import will come down. The research is being headed by professor Jitendra Sangwai from IITM’s ocean engineering department. Gas hydrates should be dissociated into their constituent gas and water before methane recovery is possible, said Sangwai. Four techniques are being studied in various laboratories for this dissociation thermal stimulation, depressurisation, chemical injection and carbon dioxide injection. Sangwai’s team analyses the combined effects of thermal stimulation and depressurisation in one branch of study, and polymer injection in another, said a press release. The research team reported that combination of two processes in more efficient for methane production from hydrates. This was attributed to relatively faster increase in volume available for the gas to expand upon application of heat. Also, instead of single-step, multistep depressurisation is more efficient. So, depressurisation is possibly the most likely technology to mature in near future, the release added. As far as polymer injection is concerned, researchers reported that eco-friendly polymer (polyethylene glycol-200) is best suited for extracting methane from hydrate. “Controlled extraction of methane from gas hydrates can not only meet the demand but can also reduce detrimental geological release of greenhouse gas into the environment from these sources,” Sangwai said. Chennai: Navy patrol damages pollution c.description: CHENNAI: Indian Navy personnel on a patrol boat damaged a buoy deployed by the National Centre for Coastal Research (NCCR) off the Chennai coast. The Rs 65lakh buoy, funded by the Centre as part of a pilot project to automate coastal water quality monitoring, was to be officially inaugurated by the Ministry of Earth Sciences (MoES) on Wednesday. Researchers in the know said that a team from NCCR, who were on a boat, were testing the buoy around 11.20am when an Indian Navy patrol boat, the fast interceptor craft, arrived. The buoy was deployed about 2km from Chennai coast and anchored at a depth of 2m. “They did not allow the team to even respond. The Navy personnel scared them with their guns and toppled the buoy before they sped away. The sensors attached to the buoy were damaged,” a researcher said. “They could have cross-checked with the Institute, as the buoy had both the government of India emblem and the name of the institute on it,” an official said. NCCR, an erstwhile project directorate and now a research lab operating under MoES has been mandated with monitoring coastal water quality across the country and recommend solutions to tackle marine pollution. NCCR scientists said they had informed all authorities concerned including the Tamil Nadu Coastal Security Group and Indian Coast Guard under whose jurisdiction the buoy was deployed. “We had informed the Navy about the deployment through the Indian Coast Guard,” a researcher said. “We do not know the extent of the damage to the buoy yet. We are trying to bring it back to the coast.” The buoy was fitted with several high cost sensors that can measure and send real time data on various water quality parameters. It includes temperature, salinity, turbidity, conductivity, chlorophyll, dissolved oxygen, acidity, and data on wave and current. The data will help research detect pollution resulting in algal bloom, mass fish kill and foaming in coastal waters faster than before. So far coastal water quality has been monitored across 7500km of the Indian coast manually, where scientists periodically venture into the sea and collect water samples to test them in their laboratories. Oceanographers with national labs said they have experienced several incidents where buoys deployed by them were vandalised by fishermen, who would escape with the solar panels attached to such floating devices. “The buoy was the result of three years hard work. We do not know when and how we can find a replacement for the device,” a scientist said. Calls and messages to the Indian Navy public relations officer in Chennai went unanswered. Aussie consulate partners with Madras Un.description: CHENNAI: The Australian Consulate-General in Chennai on Tuesday announced a partnership with University of Madras, providing funding of Rs 11 lakh. This would be used to upgrade the Centre for Australian Studies within the Department of English, under Australia’s Direct Aid Program, said an official release. Australian vice consul in Chennai, Andrew Collister, said studying Australian literature exposes Indian students to voices of a vibrant, diverse and multicultural Australia. “Education builds greater respect and understanding between our two nations, creating a bedrock for our future relations,” he added. The partnership was celebrated in an event at Madras University’s Chepauk Campus on Tuesday. Following the announcement, Collister presented sixty Australian books to the VC of the Madras university proffessor P Duraisamy. S Armstrong, professor and head of the department of English, said the upgrading of the centre with funds from the Australian Consulate-General in Chennai would benefit the academic community all over India The department has sustained a passion for Australian literature for more than two decades and has been been offering Australian Studies as a core course to its postgraduate students. Cops book 17 \u2018bus day\u2019 revelle.description: CHENNAI: A video of a group of students who were seen precariously sitting on the roof of an MTC bus falling down has created ripples among people, as such activities have become a public menace. Several of them fell off the roofPolice who identified them as students of Pachaiyappa’s college have registered cases against 17 of them and called their parents to give written undertakings on behalf of their wards that such activities will not be repeated. The video of the college students which were shared on the social media shows a bus moving slowly, where a group of students holding the bus board which carries the route number. At least 20 of them fell as the driver of the 40A bus, from Avadi to Anna Square, slammed the brakes to avoid hitting two students on a bike, who stopped their bike, right in front of the bus. However, none of them was injured. “It would have turned fatal if the bus moved further,” said an investigating officer. The Kilpauk police have arrested 17 students of Pachaiyappas College. Police said that of the 17 students, nine were already passed out from college. “They were booked for creating a public nuisance and unlawful assembly. We called their parents and advised the students not to repeat this,” said a senior police officer. Police have forwarded the names of the students to the college authorities. “If they are found involved in any such incidents again, they will be recommended for suspension,” he said. “We have put extra force to keep a vigil on the students Besides causing hindrance to the passengers, they are risking their lives. This also causes the traffic to slow down on several stretches,” he added. The Kilpauk police distributed pamphlets warning students not to interfere in unlawful activities. No arguments will be entertained with police in any issues outside and inside college premises. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Script changes in TN politics when oppn.description: Chennai: From 1991 onwards, ruling parties rarely lost bypolls in Tamil Nadu. There was a time when assembly byelections in the state were boycotted by opposition parties, such was the ominous display of muscle and money power, along with use of official machinery. But, in a reversal of the trend, the AIADMK, despite being friendly with the BJP-led government at the Centre, is struggling to face elections. The absence of the towering figure of J Jayalalithaa is being deeply felt. Jayalalithaa’s AIADMK did not lose a byelection in the period from 1991 to 1996, 2001 to 2006, and 2011 onwards. On the contrary, the AIADMK, led by chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami lost the crucial RK Nagar bypoll to rebel leader T T V Dhinakaran and again 13 of the 22 bypoll seats last month. Earlier, major parties had occasionally kept away from byelections rather than suffer defeats by huge margins, which tend to demoralize their cadres and ruling parties have tended to showcase these victories to boost their sense of superiority. So what has changed for the AIADMK, which enjoys the backing of the Centre, while its arch-rival M Karunanidhi of the DMK is no more? Though the AIADMK concentrated on the 22 assembly bypolls and deputed a galaxy of ministers in the campaigning, the DMK managed to win 13 seats, including prestigious ones like Andipatti, from where Jayalalithaa was elected in 2002 and 2006. Next up is the local body polls pending for nearly three years. Now it is the opposition that is itching for elections and believes it to be an opportunity for a changeover, while the AIADMK is on the defensive. On the ground, however, nothing has changed. Most of the voters are still inclined to accept freebies, cash-for-votes too during byelections. From RK Nagar to Sulur, the opposition has been able to trounce the AIADMK’s muscle power. A change that has come about in the mindset of the electorate is the feeling that one can accept freebies from one party and vote for another. Though frowned upon by the  Commission, such dealings continue. With offer of money from various sides, loyalty is no more a factor. The biggest challenge for the AIADMK is the uncomfortable questions raised against its legitimacy and leadership. Ever since Jayalalithaa was hospitalized, games of political upmanship while jockeying for power was the new mantra, with Resort politics being thrown in. Questions are being raised about the foundation of the government. The twists and turns, rebellion, constant shifting of sides and positions, claims and counter-claims of support among MLAs, have all led to the charge that the government survives as it is a beneficiary of the acts of the governor, election commission and the Centre. The perception is that the fragile government, which survives on a wafer-thin majority thanks to the disqualification moves, relies heavily on the BJP to bail it out. While Jayalalithaa avoided an alliance with the BJP to prevent a consolidation of minority votes in favour of the DMK-led combine, the EPS government is in a catch-22 situation where it needs the BJP’s help to survive and yet this pushes the AIADMK into the "unpopular" NDA bandwagon. Thus, an anti-incumbency factor, coupled with feelings against the BJP in the state have proved to be a double whammy for the AIADMK. This situation has been well-fashioned and crafted by the DMK, with its new president M K Stalin, winning over several parties to his side and creating a formidable opposition to the AIADMK. It is not that EPS has done badly as chief minister. He has been accessible, acquired the reputation of clearing files quickly and kept the flock of MLAs happy. Left to himself, EPS would have reached a compromise with the Dhinakaran group and kept them within the AIADMK fold. What is galling for him is that having expelled them, he is now asked to take them back, after they ruined the party’s prospects in the 2019 elections. Such U-turns have weakened the party in the eyes of the people and also caused confusion within the ranks. That is why every bypoll brings a crisis for the AIADMK which struggles without a charismatic leader like MGR or Jayalalithaa to bring them non-committed votes. (The writer is a veteran journalist) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

If it’s sultry outside, these peeps turn up the heat inside the watering holes, sporting the trendiest stuff of the season. Traffic flow on Velachery bridge affecte.description: CHENNAI: The demolition of encroached properties near Velachery MRTS station threw traffic out of gear on the Velachery bridge. Motorists parking their vehicles on the bridge to take photographs and videos of the demolition added to the congestion. Railway commuters also expressed displeasure as police did not allow public to keep vehicles in the parking area near the encroached structures. “The situation is expected to continue for a week. The public should use the parking facility on the other side of the railway station,” a Railway Protection Force (RPF) inspector said. Vehicles were also not allowed to use the access road to the railway station under the bridge while coming from Vijayanagar for the major part of the day, forcing motorists to take a circuitous route to reach the station. About 200 police personnel from Chennai City police, 150 Government Railway Police (GRP) and 55 personnel from Railway Protection Force (RPF) were deployed at the demolition site. Apart from ensuring that the demolition process went ahead without any hindrance, police also had their task cut out in preventing curious onlookers from getting close to the buildings being demolished. “Everyone wants to take photos and videos of this demolition,” a police inspector said. Students who were enrolled in various courses offered by institutes and coaching classes for entrance exams functioning out of the encroached area were also affected. “I did not turn up for classes for two days last week. So, I rang up today to enquire if classes will be held. The number was switched off. I never knew that this was going to happen,” said K Surya of Adambakkam who had paid Rs 15,000 for a networking course at a software training institute. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Jayalalithaa memorial will be ready in f.description: CHENNAI: Tamil Nadu chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami on Tuesday said the memorial being built for former chief minister J Jayalalithaa would be completed in five months. He was speaking to the reporters after reviewing the construction work at the site on Marina. “The public works department has been told to speed up work that began on May last year. It has been taken up at an estimated cost of Rs 50.8 crore,” he said. At least 60% of the technical work, involving intricacies had been completed so far. The grand memorial with a resemblance of a phoenix with lions standing guard is spread over 50,000sq ft. The state government expected at least one lakh visitors to the memorial on an average every day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Demanding teachers, students block highw.description: DHARMAPURI: Students of the government school at Periyampatty in Dharmapuri district, without teachers for many subjects, including science and mathematics, on Tuesday blocked a state highway demanding appointment of teachers to the school. Students of Classes XI and XII said there were no teachers for many subjects since the academic year began. “We have been sitting in class doing nothing. The administration has failed to appoint teachers,” they said. Education department officials and police arrived and tried to placate the students, promising to take steps to depute teachers from other government schools. “Since permanent transfer of teachers can be done only during teachers’ counselling, we decided to transfer teachers temporarily,” an official. The students withdrew the protest. Traffic between Dharmapuri and Periyampatty was affected for about an hour. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ramadoss urges Tamil Nadu govt to create.description: CHENNAI: PMK founder S Ramadoss on Tuesday urged the Tamil Nadu government create new districts for effective administration and speedy growth. Referring to the newly formed government in Andhra Pradesh, which is taking efforts to create new districts and double the number of districts from the existing 13, Ramadoss said that such measures would benefit the government for effective administration. Ramadoss, in a press statement, said the Tamil Nadu government should adopt the “small is beautiful” principle. There were around 22 lakh people in each of the districts in the state and few districts spread over for 200 km from one end to another. It would be difficult to administer and implement government schemes effectively. Hence, the government should take measures to create new districts, each having a population of around 12 lakh, for speedy development. The government should expedite legal courses towards this.
