This space is more about celebrating you, along with a great mix of food, cocktails and rivetting conversation,” says the management team, and adds, “We are driven to build a craft cocktail bar where seasonal cocktails that are fresh and unique take centre stage.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Madras high court: Hype over film associ.description: CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Tuesday observed that more hype has been created over the election to South India Film Artistes Association (SIFAA), popularly known as Nadigar Sangam, than the elections to parliament and state legislative assembly. Here people are attracted towards film actors and express more concern on their favourite actors than their parents, Justice N Anand Venkatesh said. Making it clear that the court is totally not concerned about the election, the judge added that his concern is only about the inconvenience caused to the public during the election and steps taken to manage the crowd. The court then directed the association to find out an alternative place to conduct the polling as it could not be organised in Dr MGR-Janaki Arts and Science College for Women in R A Puram as planned on June 23. Earlier, the association informed the court that it is planning to book Meenakashi College in Kodambakkam. However, the court suggested the association to look for a better place with adequate parking facility, preferably YMCA in Nandanam and inform the court on Wednesday. The issue pertains to a plea moved by the association seeking police protection during the polling. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Chennai: Government departments allowed.description: CHENNAI: The state government in 2003 allotted 4.67 acres of poramboke land in Velachery to the railways for the MRTS project, cancelling a 1992 GO that allotted one cent each to 97 people and making any occupation on the land an encroachment. However, despite the land being allotted to the railways, illegal structures were allowed to come up on the encroached land in the past decade and half- providing pattas, electricity and water connections. A railway official said two AIADMK leaders raised buildings and rented them out to commercial enterprises. One of them, who runs a fish market and whose appeal against an eviction notice was dismissed by the Madras high court, has still sought time from the Supreme Court. The market will be demolished in two weeks, railways officials said. Lodging facilities, restaurants, clinics, scan centres, yoga studios and even a NEET coaching centre had sprung up in the illegal buildings. All were brought down. The owner of a lodging facility who claimed to have bought the property six years ago and several others appealed to the authorities, showing receipts of property tax, electricity bills. Some asked if the authorities would demolish colleges and hospitals built on such land. The police personnel present maintained a stoic response, “Authorities are just following court orders. We are here only for protection,” said an officer. Railway officials blamed the revenue, corporation and registration departments for enabling the encroachments. “Without the support of government departments, these businesses could not have run. Most commercial establishments have come up in the past 10 years, now paying Rs 30,000 a month for about 430 sq ft,” an official said. The Madras high court has asked the inspector general of registration to find out how many properties had been sold with the connivance of the sub-registrar concerned. Madras high court slams government for n.description: CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Tuesday censored the Tamil Nadu government for failing to take precautionary measures to tackle the prevailing water crisis in the state, particularly in Chennai. Not convinced with the eight-page report filed by Metrowater elaborating the measures it has taken to overcome the situation, a division bench of Justice S Manikumar and Justice Subramonium Prasad wondered what the water management department of the state was doing all these days. The authorities very well knew that the lakes in and around the city are drying but still no precautionary measures were taken to arrange alternate sources for the past one year, the bench said. Ridiculing the authorities for submitting that they have started awareness programmes highlighting the importance of water conservation, the bench wondered what is the use of doing such awareness work at this point of time. The bench then suo motu impleaded the secretary of PWD to file a report on the steps taken to de-silt four major reservoirs in the city and availability of water. The bench said judicial notice can also be taken that some of the waterbodies have been encroached which has reduced the size of the lake and encroachment is also said to be one of the causes of the reduction of storage capacity of lakes and water bodies. The court then directed the secretary who is vested with the custody of preserving the lakes to submit a detailed report of the steps taken for removal of encroachment. In this regard the secretary is directed to issue a circular to all the district collectors to submit the details of action taken for removal of encroachments in waterbodies, the court said. As the advocate general submitted that once the third desalination plant being established in Nemelli becomes functional, even failure of monsoon would not affect Chennai, the bench directed the authorities to submit a report of desalination project taken up by the government, study, if any, done for additional desalination plants. The court then posted the plea to June 26 for further hearing. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AIADMK not to oppose key bills in Parlia.description: CHENNAI: With the first session of the 17th Lok Sabha beginning Monday, the ruling AIADMK has decided not to oppose the contentious dam safety and motor vehicles bills nor confront the NDA government. While its lone MP in the LS and 13 members in RS will raise concerns of the state and move amendments, it will not stand in the way of passage of crucial bills in both Houses, sources said. The controversial clauses of the bills were taken up by chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami in his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday, seeking his intervention. “There will not be any confrontation with the Centre nor any opposition to the bills. We will continue to raise the concerns of the state as they (Centre) are concerned about the entire nation. The amendments will be moved by the MPs as per instructions from the high command,” said a senior AIADMK leader. While the dam safety bill was introduced in LS in December last year, the motor vehicles amendments bill was passed in April and both lapsed with the dissolution of the 16th Lok Sabha. The Tamil Nadu assembly had passed an unanimous resolution in June last year not to enact a law on dam safety until the states were consulted and consensus was evolved. The main concern of the state was that the bill envisages a national dam safety authority that would act as state dam safety organization for a dam located in one state and owned by another. It would only mean that the state owning the dam would have no rights over the safety and maintenance of the dam located in another state. Mullaperiyar, Parambikulam, Thunakadavu and Peruvaripallam dams are owned, operated and maintained by Tamil Nadu by inter-state agreements, but located in Kerala. With 37 MPs, the AIADMK, as the third largest party in Parliament, had raised strong objections when the bills were introduced last year. “This time, the AIADMK will only object to eroding the rights of Tamil Nadu, which is a violation of the federal principles, and seek amendments to the clauses,” said a senior minister. While the Centre aims at reforming the transport sector with the proposed amendments to Motor Vehicles Act, 1988, the Tamil Nadu government demands that the Centre modifies five clauses, which even overruns the nationalisation policy of the state. A clause eliminates the monopoly of the states to carry on transport business and feared to weaken or even terminate the service of state transport undertakings. Missing man found dead in Cooum river in.description: CHENNAI: The body of 39-year-old man, who had been missing since Saturday, was found floating in the Cooum river here on Tuesday. The deceased man has been identified as Jeevan Patrick of Anna Nagar West Extension. He was married and is survived by his wife and two children. Police said Patrick left home on Saturday and had been missing since then. His family members lodged a complaint with the Aminjikarai police to trace him. On Tuesday, passersby noticed the body floating in the river beside the Pallavan Salai and alerted police and fire and rescue services personnel who retrieved the body. The Triplicane police, who registered a case, said they were inquiring if the man had slipped into the river by accident and drowned or jumped into the river to commit suicide. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil.
